intro: Memecylon bakossiense, commonly known as the Bakossi memecylon, is a shrub native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round fruits. Memecylon bakossiense is often found in moist, shaded understory habitats within dense forest ecosystems.
